metadata.title: CVE-2017-9526 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In Libgcrypt before 1.7.7, an attacker who learns the EdDSA session key(from side-channel observation during the signing process) can easilyrecover the long-term secret key. 1.7.7 makes a cipher/ecc-eddsa.c changeto store this session key in secure memory, to ensure that constant-timepoint operations are used in the MPI library.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgcrypt20 - 1.6.5-2ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgcrypt20 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-2ubuntu0.3').
